title: David James 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of tire rubber and plum lead to soft, sweet cherry and mocha flavors. It's a solid, easy drinker.

title: Cairdean Estate 2011 Acquaintance Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Coombsville)
description: This 76% Cabernet Franc and 24% Malbec blend pushes the coolness of the vintage and the appellation in its extremely herbal, woody nose, a taste of bell pepper rising midway through its lean palate. It finishes round and soft.

title: Brancott 2014 Flight Song Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)
description: This low-alcohol offering exhibits less weight and richness as a result. Still, it's a pleasant, lean white that relies on lemony flavors to provide crisp refreshment.

title: Brennan 2014 Reserve Viognier (Texas)
description: Vanilla candle wax, pollen and peaches-and-cream aromas are inviting and warm. The luscious body of juicy stone fruit is overcome by soapy floral notes on the midpalate, yet the persistent acid manages to clean up the flavors on the finish.

title: Earth's Harvest 2014 Organic Grapes Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine has a deep-gold color, attractive baking-spice and buttered popcorn aromas, appealing apple and pear flavors and medium body. The texture is soft and easy and the acidity tastes low.

title: Gustave Lorentz 2014 Riesling (Alsace)
description: The lemony freshness that the nose promises is slightly unbalanced on the bright palate but the flavors are clean and invigorating. This easydrinking wine would make a perfect party apéritif.

title: Mount Pleasant Winery NV Tawny Port Library Vol. XVI Port (Augusta)
description: Orange spice and almond-skin aromas are sharp and hot on the nose. Sultana, dried apricot and orange spice flavors mark the viscous palate. There's barely enough acidity to keep everything in check, yet a pleasant walnut-skin note marks the finish.

title: Illinois Sparkling Co. NV Franken's French Hybrid Brut Sparkling (Illinois)
description: This brut sparkler is made from Chambourcin, a hybrid grape of uncertain parentage. Fresh figs and dates come to mind on the nose, while the linear palate is persistently citrus-driven.

title: Indomita 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This is an overtly oaky Cabernet with resiny, balsamic aromas that share space with baked black-fruit scents. The palate feels flabby and fat, with modest tannic grip. Jammy blueberry and cassis flavors end oaky, resiny and jammy.

title: Inspire Moore 2014 Gratitude White (Finger Lakes)
description: Whiffs of nuts, dusty mineral and lemon are demure on the nose, but become more concentrated on the palate of this dry white. A blend of Chardonnay, Riesling and Grüner Veltliner, it's more minerally than fruity, but refreshing and brisk.

title: Intipalka 2010 Valle del Sol No 1 Gran Reserva Red (Ica)
description: At first, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Tannat and Syrah smells so baked and oaky that it seems overripe. In the mouth, the tannins are like sandpaper, while oaky flavors of rooty, baked berry fruits end timid, with a heavy slathering of residual barrel flavors.
designation: Valle del Sol No 1 Gran Reserva

title: Falernia 2013 Pedriscal Vineyard Reserva Carmenère (Elqui Valley)
description: Murky, mulchy aromas of baked black fruits and coffee grinds set up a gritty, hard palate of barrel char and roasted berry fruits. The finish is more of the same—lots of oak, burnt coffee and baked black-fruit flavors.

title: François Lurton 2013 Gran Aracauno Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Scattered aromas of black olive and stewed berry fruits lead to a heavy, awkward palate. This tastes strained, with burnt, leafy black-fruit flavors and a soft, low-acid finish.

title: Mayu 2014 Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley)
description: Creamy aromas of vanilla and honeydew come in front of a waxy, pulpy palate. This oddball varietal tastes peachy and melony, while the finish is dry, waxy and plump. This is good but lacks detail and shape.

title: La Playa 2015 Estate Series Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)
description: Floral, oily aromas mis with melon and honeysuckle on the nose. The palate feels round and healthy, with briny flavors of green melon offset by sweeter honey notes. A short but clean finish offers a twinge of minerality on this blend of 85% Viognier and 15% Chardonnay.

title: Nevada Ridge 2011 Barbera (Nevada)
description: There are lots of dried tones to the nose: herbs, meat and hay. The palate shows more fruit, with tart cherry and raspberry flavors giving a snappy resistance to the grippy, sandy tannins.

title: Silver Palm 2013 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Crisp and firm-textured, this wine has savory, lightly herbal aromas, flavors like pear juice and mineral water, and an engaging, rather thick mouthfeel that helps the flavors seems layered and complex.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2012 Clos Jus Premier Cru  (Givry)
description: Behind the firm tannins there is a fruity wine here. It has red-berry flavors that are lifted by acidity and given shape by tannins. At the same time, it is a light wine, likely to age fast, wearing its fresh fruitiness easily. Drink from 2016.

title: Viña Casablanca 2013 Cefiro Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Blackberry aromas lead to a round palate housing rubbery tannins. Baked black-fruit flavors are heavily oaked, and the finish is a bit hot and rough.

title: Treleaven 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)
description: Intensely smoky, savory nut and bramble tones cast a dark shadow on tart black plum and currants in this Cabernet Franc. It's not deeply concentrated, but approachable and refreshing, marked by sharp cranberry acidity on the midpalate.

title: Caliterra 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)
description: Dry, light aromas of passion fruit, melon and bell pepper are restrained. The palate feels in balance, with orange tones and herbal flavors.

title: Balduzzi 2010 B Red (Maule Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère blend is a green machine with a pyrazine-led explosion of green bean and bell pepper aromas. Robust and grabby on the palate, this tastes heavily of herbal plum and canned green bean, while a minty finish includes flavors of olive and bitterness. This feels right but smells and tastes extremely green.

title: Bending Branch 2012 Newsom Vineyard Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)
description: Cherries-and-cream aromas are high-toned on the nose. Sweet plastic flavors mix with additional red berry tones on the light-bodied palate, with a toasted note rounding out the finish.

title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Don Feli Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Sawdust and wild-berry aromas are loud on the nose. Flabby in feel, with a slight sense of rawness, this tastes of briar patch and wood, with candied plum and berry fruit. Rubbery tannins make for a rocky finish.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2011 Cunat Reserve Red (Oak Knoll District)
description: Juicy in blackberry and cassis, with a strong Bordeaux-varietal rush of peppercorn and herb, this wine leans green and tight on the palate, aiming for a classical style from a cool year and cool region.

title: Jason-Stephens 2013 Select Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: The nose of this light-colored wine offers showy apple blossom and pineapple aromas, leaning into the ripe and tropical side of the grape spectrum. it delivers crisp energy once sipped, with very fruit-forward apple flavors and even a touch of guava.

title: Glenora 2013 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: While crisp black plum and cherry notes are refreshing, persistent green pepper and herb notes lend a lean, slightly vegetal tone. Medium bodied and brisk in composure, the finish is brisk and clean.

title: Glenora 2013 Meritage (Finger Lakes)
description: While ripe on the nose and luscious in mouthfeel, this taut, nervy Bordeaux-style blend showcases sweet-tart pomegranate and cranberry flavors. It's a lean, but refreshing wine with a crisp finish.

title: Pepi 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Savory rather than simply fruity flavors are the strong point of this medium-bodied and well-balanced wine. It tastes almost like melon wrapped in prosciutto as meaty, earthy nuances blend with modest fruit accents.

title: Longevity 2011 Vintner Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Big and bold in body, earthy in aroma and showing ample fruit flavors, this assertive and high-alcohol wine packs quite a punch in texture, too. The impact of lots of tannin is apparent in the astringency.
